explanation: Not correct. Rule 21.17 forbids uses of <string.h> routines that can access beyond the bounds of the objects passed. The call strcmp(method, "GET") would only violate the rule if 'method' could be NULL or point to a non‑NUL‑terminated buffer. In this code 'method' is the HTTP method string supplied by libmicrohttpd via the request callback registered with MHD_start_daemon. The callback contract supplied by the MHD API guarantees that method is a pointer to a valid, NUL‑terminated method name (and the rest of the codebase also freely uses strcmp on 'method' throughout). There is no evidence in the provided code that 'method' can be NULL or unterminated, so the strcmp usage does not by itself contravene Rule 21.17. (If an analyzer cannot prove the callback precondition, a defensive NULL/termination check or an explicit comment/documented precondition can be added to satisfy static checks.)
